urls.title: Shutdowns prevented 60 million coronavirus infections in the U.S., study finds
urls.description: Another study estimated that the shutdowns saved about 3.1 million lives in 11 European countries and dropped infection rates by an average of 82 percent. Both reports were published Monday in the journal Nature.

domain.name: Person
domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela

entity.name: Dena Grayson
entity.description: an American medical doctor, researcher and politician

text:
A separate study from @imperialcollege estimated that **lockdowns saved ~3.1 million lives in 11 European countries** and dropped infection rates by an average of 82%, sufficient to drive the contagion well below epidemic levels.

#coronavirus 
https://t.co/hQndM3i21t
